summary: Acquired by the Bank of Montreal in 1984, the Harris Trust & Savings Bank, a Chicago Landmark at 111 W. Monroe St., showcases Classical Revival and International Style architecture, designed by Shepley, Rutan, & Coolidge and Skidmore, Owings, & Merrill with Walter A. Netsch respectively. The City Council of the City of Chicago confirmed its landmark status on April 3, 2025, under three Municipal Code criteria. Notable features include bas relief bronze lion sculptures and a suitable plaque, as per the ordinance.
